title: Steve Molloy
text:
Stephen John Molloy (born 11 March 1969) is an English former professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1990s and 2000s, and <a href="Coach%20%28sport%29">coach</a>ed in the 2000s. He played at representative level for <a href="Great%20Britain%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Great Britain</a> and <a href="England%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">England</a>, and at club level for <a href="Warrington%20Wolves">Warrington</a> (<a href="List%20of%20Warrington%20Wolves%20players">Heritage No. 879</a>), <a href="Leeds%20Rhinos">Leeds</a>, <a href="Featherstone%20Rovers">Featherstone Rovers</a> (<a href="List%20of%20Featherstone%20Rovers%20players">Heritage No. 699</a>) (<a href="Captain%20%28sports%29">captain</a>), <a href="Sheffield%20Eagles">Sheffield Eagles</a>, <a href="Oldham%20R.L.F.C.">Oldham</a> (<a href="List%20of%20Oldham%20R.L.F.C.%20players">Heritage No. 1112</a>) (two spells), -<a href="Sheffield%20Eagles%23Huddersfield%E2%80%93Sheffield%20Giants">Sheffield Giants</a>, <a href="Huddersfield%20Giants">Huddersfield Giants</a> and <a href="Batley%20Bulldogs">Batley Bulldogs</a>, as a , i.e. number 8 or 10, and coached at club level for <a href="Oldham%20R.L.F.C.">Oldham</a>. Steve is the current Head Coach of the ambitious Manchester Rangers RLFC who are currently working on plans to enter the semi-professional & professional ranks in the near future.
Background.
Steve Molloy was born in <a href="Gorton">Gorton</a>, <a href="Manchester">Manchester</a>, <a href="Lancashire">Lancashire</a>, England. Nickname Big Face
Playing career.
International honours.
Steve Molloy won <a href="Cap%20%28sport%29">cap</a>s for <a href="England%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">England</a> while at Leeds in 1992 against Wales, while at Featherstone Rovers in 1996 against France (<a href="Rugby%20league%20positions%23Interchange">interchange</a>/<a href="Substitution%20%28sport%29">substitute</a>), and Wales, while at Sheffield Eagles in 1999 against France (2 matches), and won <a href="Cap%20%28sport%29">cap</a>s for <a href="Great%20Britain%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Great Britain</a> while at Leeds in 1993 against France, while at Featherstone Rovers in 1994 against Fiji, 1996 against Fiji (<a href="Rugby%20league%20positions%23Interchange">interchange</a>/<a href="Substitution%20%28sport%29">substitute</a>), and New Zealand (<a href="Rugby%20league%20positions%23Interchange">interchange</a>/<a href="Substitution%20%28sport%29">substitute</a>).
County Cup Final appearances.
Steve Molloy played right-, i.e. number 10, in <a href="Warrington%20Wolves">Warrington</a>'s 24–16 victory over <a href="Oldham%20R.L.F.C.">Oldham</a> in the <a href="1989%20Lancashire%20Cup">1989</a> <a href="RFL%20Lancashire%20Cup">Lancashire</a> <a href="Rugby%20league%20county%20cups">County Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1989%E2%80%9390%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1989–90 season</a> at <a href="Knowsley%20Road">Knowsley Road</a>, <a href="St%20Helens%2C%20Merseyside">St. Helens</a> on Saturday 14 October 1989.
Club career.
Molloy made his début for <a href="Warrington%20Wolves">Warrington</a> on Sunday 28 August 1988, and he played his last match for Warrington on Monday 16 April 1990, he made his début for <a href="Featherstone%20Rovers">Featherstone Rovers</a> on Sunday 29 August 1993, and he played his last match for Featherstone Rovers during the 1997 season.
